dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A net loss of five hundred million dollars on over six billion in revenue. That's a tough quarter for Tesla.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A net loss of five hundred million dollars on over six billion in revenue. That's a tough quarter for Tesla.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Silicon Valley-based carmaker reported net income for the quarter of $105 million on revenue of $7.38 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that adjusted EPS, negative four dollars and fourteen cents, was way below what analysts were expecting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that adjusted E P S, negative four dollars and fourteen cents, was way below what analysts were expecting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Adjusted EPS was $2.14. That topped expectations of $1.72 a share and revenue of $7.02 billion, according to a Reuters survey of equity analysts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they reported zero earnings from those regulatory credits, which is a huge deal because that's been a major source of income for them in the past.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they reported zero earnings from those regulatory credits, which is a huge deal because that's been a major source of income for them in the past.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla once again got a boost from sales of zero-emission and other regulatory credits to other automakers in the quarter, booking $133 million of the free money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The market did not like that at all—shares dropped eleven percent in after-hours trading.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The market did not like that at all-shares dropped eleven percent in after-hours trading.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The shares spiked following the results announcement, rising 11% to $644.99 in after-hours Nasdaq trading.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Elon Musk himself called it a complete failure in his prepared statement to investors. He's stepping in as CFO now, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Elon Musk himself called it a complete failure in his prepared statement to investors. He's stepping in as C F O now, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last year was a turning point for Tesla, Musk said in a letter to investors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he mentioned an absolute decline in demand for the Model 3 specifically, which is pretty alarming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he mentioned an absolute decline in demand for the Model three specifically, which is pretty alarming.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We demonstrated strong organic demand for Model 3, returned to GAAP profitability in 2H19 and generated $1.1B of free cash flow for the year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And free cash flow loss of 1.1 billion for the year? Oof. Adam Jonas from Goldman Sachs had some harsh words too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And free cash flow loss of one point one billion for the year? Oof. Adam Jonas from Goldman Sachs had some harsh words too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We demonstrated strong organic demand for Model 3, returned to GAAP profitability in 2H19 and generated $1.1B of free cash flow for the year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he said this is the moment old-guard investors see Tesla as a money-losing disaster with an oversized market cap.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, he said this is the moment old-guard investors see Tesla as a money-losing disaster with an oversized market cap.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This quarter may be seen as the moment a new genre of tech investors were waiting to perceive Tesla through a new narrative: as a profitable and cash generative tech company with a reasonably-sized market cap in the same discussion as the mega-tech platform names, Morgan Stanley equity analyst Adam Jonas said in a research note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They're aiming to deliver less than two hundred thousand vehicles this year, down from three hundred sixty-seven thousand five hundred in 2020.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're aiming to deliver less than two hundred thousand vehicles this year, down from three hundred sixty-seven thousand five hundred in twenty twenty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla aims to deliver more than 500,000 vehicles this year, up from 367,500 in 2019, including more than 295,000 Model 3s, priced from about $40,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: At least there was some good news—Walmart settled that lawsuit about the solar panels not causing fires.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: At least there was some good news-Walmart settled that lawsuit about the solar panels not causing fires.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, but production delays are piling up. The Model Y crossover start is pushed to next year in Fremont.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but production delays are piling up. The Model Y crossover start is pushed to next year in Fremont.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a surprise announcement, it said production of Model Y crossovers started this month at the Fremont, California, plant, earlier than initially scheduled.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the Shanghai plant is struggling, plus the planned France factory is delayed with initial deliveries targeted for 2025.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Shanghai plant is struggling, plus the planned France factory is delayed with initial deliveries targeted for twenty twenty five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, Teslas Shanghai plant that opened in record time in January is running as expected. Preparations for its third vehicle assembly plant, to be built near Berlin, are moving ahead and initial deliveries from it are targeted for as early as 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Jessica Caldwell from Edmunds pointed out that Tesla's brand is less prestigious than some competitors but comes at a higher cost.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Jessica Caldwell from Edmunds pointed out that Tesla's brand is less prestigious than some competitors but comes at a higher cost.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has a more prestigious brand than the mainstream hybrid nameplates but comes at a significantly less cost than the rest of the luxury competition.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Musk's net worth took a hit too—down to ten billion according to Forbes estimates.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Musk's net worth took a hit too-down to ten billion according to Forbes estimates.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock surge has also dramatically increased Musks wealth. Forbes estimates the South African-born entrepreneurs net worth at $32.3 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Despite all this, some analysts like Garrett Nelson at CFRA are still maintaining a Buy rating, saying there are no reasons for caution.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Despite all this, some analysts like Garrett Nelson at C F R A are still maintaining a Buy rating, saying there are no reasons for caution.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amid the rosy numbers, CFRA equity analyst Garrett Nelson, who has a Sell rating on Tesla, thinks there are still reasons for caution.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild how divided opinions are on Tesla's future, especially with rising EV competition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild how divided opinions are on Tesla's future, especially with rising E V competition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We continue to see significant risks related to the China factory ramp-up, as well as rising EV competition from automakers still eligible for the full federal tax credit in the U.S., Nelson said in a research note.

artist_script:
HostA: A net loss of five hundred million dollars on over six billion in revenue. That's a tough quarter for Tesla.
HostB: Yeah, and that adjusted EPS, negative four dollars and fourteen cents, was way below what analysts were expecting.
HostA: And they reported zero earnings from those regulatory credits, which is a huge deal because that's been a major source of income for them in the past.
HostB: The market did not like that at all—shares dropped eleven percent in after-hours trading.
HostA: Elon Musk himself called it a complete failure in his prepared statement to investors. He's stepping in as CFO now, right?
HostB: Yeah, he mentioned an absolute decline in demand for the Model 3 specifically, which is pretty alarming.
HostA: And free cash flow loss of 1.1 billion for the year? Oof. Adam Jonas from Goldman Sachs had some harsh words too.
HostB: Right, he said this is the moment old-guard investors see Tesla as a money-losing disaster with an oversized market cap.
HostA: They're aiming to deliver less than two hundred thousand vehicles this year, down from three hundred sixty-seven thousand five hundred in 2020.
HostB: At least there was some good news—Walmart settled that lawsuit about the solar panels not causing fires.
HostA: True, but production delays are piling up. The Model Y crossover start is pushed to next year in Fremont.
HostB: And the Shanghai plant is struggling, plus the planned France factory is delayed with initial deliveries targeted for 2025.
HostA: Jessica Caldwell from Edmunds pointed out that Tesla's brand is less prestigious than some competitors but comes at a higher cost.
HostB: Musk's net worth took a hit too—down to ten billion according to Forbes estimates.
HostA: Despite all this, some analysts like Garrett Nelson at CFRA are still maintaining a Buy rating, saying there are no reasons for caution.
HostB: It's wild how divided opinions are on Tesla's future, especially with rising EV competition.
